00088  * Hash constant words K for SHA-256:

00090 const static sha2_word32 K256[64] = {
00091         0x428a2f98UL, 0x71374491UL, 0xb5c0fbcfUL, 0xe9b5dba5UL,
00092         0x3956c25bUL, 0x59f111f1UL, 0x923f82a4UL, 0xab1c5ed5UL,
00093         0xd807aa98UL, 0x12835b01UL, 0x243185beUL, 0x550c7dc3UL,

00096         0x2de92c6fUL, 0x4a7484aaUL, 0x5cb0a9dcUL, 0x76f988daUL,
00097         0x983e5152UL, 0xa831c66dUL, 0xb00327c8UL, 0xbf597fc7UL,
00098         0xc6e00bf3UL, 0xd5a79147UL, 0x06ca6351UL, 0x14292967UL,
00099         0x27b70a85UL, 0x2e1b2138UL, 0x4d2c6dfcUL, 0x53380d13UL,
00100         0x650a7354UL, 0x766a0abbUL, 0x81c2c92eUL, 0x92722c85UL,
00101         0xa2bfe8a1UL, 0xa81a664bUL, 0xc24b8b70UL, 0xc76c51a3UL,
00102         0xd192e819UL, 0xd6990624UL, 0xf40e3585UL, 0x106aa070UL,
00103         0x19a4c116UL, 0x1e376c08UL, 0x2748774cUL, 0x34b0bcb5UL,

00109 /*
00110  * Initial hash value H for SHA-256:
00111  */
00112 const static sha2_word32 sha256_initial_hash_value[8] = {
00113         0x6a09e667UL,
00114         0xbb67ae85UL,
00115         0x3c6ef372UL,
00116         0xa54ff53aUL,
00117         0x510e527fUL,
00118         0x9b05688cUL,
00119         0x1f83d9abUL,
00120         0x5be0cd19UL
00121 };

00124 /*

00128 static const char *sha2_hex_digits = "0123456789abcdef";

00130 /*** SHA-256: *********************************************************/

00136 void SHA256::SHA256_Init(SHA256_CTX* context) {
00137         if (context == (SHA256_CTX*)0) {
00138                 return;
00139         }
00140         MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->state, sha256_initial_hash_value, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00141         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00142         context->bitcount = 0;
00143 }
00144 
00145 #ifdef SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM
00146 
00147 /* Unrolled SHA-256 round macros: */
00148 
00149 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00150 
00151 #define ROUND256_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00152         REVERSE32(*data++, W256[j]); \
00153         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + \
00154              K256[j] + W256[j]; \
00155         (d) += T1; \
00156         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_256(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00157         j++
00158 
00159 
00160 #else /* BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00161 
00162 #define ROUND256_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00163         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + \
00164              K256[j] + (W256[j] = *data++); \
00165         (d) += T1; \
00166         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_256(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00167         j++
00168 
00169 #endif /* BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00170 
00171 #define ROUND256(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00172         s0 = W256[(j+1)&0x0f]; \
00173         s0 = sigma0_256(s0); \
00174         s1 = W256[(j+14)&0x0f]; \
00175         s1 = sigma1_256(s1); \
00176         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + K256[j] + \
00177              (W256[j&0x0f] += s1 + W256[(j+9)&0x0f] + s0); \
00178         (d) += T1; \
00179         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_256(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00180         j++
00181 
00187 void SHA256::SHA256_Transform(SHA256_CTX* context, const sha2_word32* data) {
00188         sha2_word32     a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, s0, s1;
00189         sha2_word32     T1, *W256;
00190         int             j;
00191 
00192         W256 = (sha2_word32*)context->buffer;
00193 
00194         /* Initialize registers with the prev. intermediate value */
00195         a = context->state[0];
00196         b = context->state[1];
00197         c = context->state[2];
00198         d = context->state[3];
00199         e = context->state[4];
00200         f = context->state[5];
00201         g = context->state[6];
00202         h = context->state[7];
00203 
00204         j = 0;
00205         do {
00206                 /* Rounds 0 to 15 (unrolled): */
00207                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h);
00208                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(h,a,b,c,d,e,f,g);
00209                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(g,h,a,b,c,d,e,f);
00210                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(f,g,h,a,b,c,d,e);
00211                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(e,f,g,h,a,b,c,d);
00212                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(d,e,f,g,h,a,b,c);
00213                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(c,d,e,f,g,h,a,b);
00214                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(b,c,d,e,f,g,h,a);
00215         } while (j < 16);
00216 
00217         /* Now for the remaining rounds to 64: */
00218         do {
00219                 ROUND256(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h);
00220                 ROUND256(h,a,b,c,d,e,f,g);
00221                 ROUND256(g,h,a,b,c,d,e,f);
00222                 ROUND256(f,g,h,a,b,c,d,e);
00223                 ROUND256(e,f,g,h,a,b,c,d);
00224                 ROUND256(d,e,f,g,h,a,b,c);
00225                 ROUND256(c,d,e,f,g,h,a,b);
00226                 ROUND256(b,c,d,e,f,g,h,a);
00227         } while (j < 64);
00228 
00229         /* Compute the current intermediate hash value */
00230         context->state[0] += a;
00231         context->state[1] += b;
00232         context->state[2] += c;
00233         context->state[3] += d;
00234         context->state[4] += e;
00235         context->state[5] += f;
00236         context->state[6] += g;
00237         context->state[7] += h;
00238 
00239         /* Clean up */
00240         a = b = c = d = e = f = g = h = T1 = 0;
00241 }
00242 
00243 #else /* SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM */
00244 
00250 void SHA256::SHA256_Transform(SHA256_CTX* context, const sha2_word32* data) {
00251         sha2_word32     a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, s0, s1;
00252         sha2_word32     T1, T2, *W256;
00253         int             j;
00254 
00255         W256 = (sha2_word32*)context->buffer;
00256 
00257         /* Initialize registers with the prev. intermediate value */
00258         a = context->state[0];
00259         b = context->state[1];
00260         c = context->state[2];
00261         d = context->state[3];
00262         e = context->state[4];
00263         f = context->state[5];
00264         g = context->state[6];
00265         h = context->state[7];
00266 
00267         j = 0;
00268         do {
00269 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00270                 /* Copy data while converting to host byte order */
00271                 REVERSE32(*data++,W256[j]);
00272                 /* Apply the SHA-256 compression function to update a..h */
00273                 T1 = h + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K256[j] + W256[j];
00274 #else /* BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00275                 /* Apply the SHA-256 compression function to update a..h with copy */
00276                 T1 = h + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K256[j] + (W256[j] = *data++);
00277 #endif /* BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00278                 T2 = Sigma0_256(a) + Maj(a, b, c);
00279                 h = g;
00280                 g = f;
00281                 f = e;
00282                 e = d + T1;
00283                 d = c;
00284                 c = b;
00285                 b = a;
00286                 a = T1 + T2;
00287 
00288                 j++;
00289         } while (j < 16);
00290 
00291         do {
00292                 /* Part of the message block expansion: */
00293                 s0 = W256[(j+1)&0x0f];
00294                 s0 = sigma0_256(s0);
00295                 s1 = W256[(j+14)&0x0f]; 
00296                 s1 = sigma1_256(s1);
00297 
00298                 /* Apply the SHA-256 compression function to update a..h */
00299                 T1 = h + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K256[j] + 
00300                      (W256[j&0x0f] += s1 + W256[(j+9)&0x0f] + s0);
00301                 T2 = Sigma0_256(a) + Maj(a, b, c);
00302                 h = g;
00303                 g = f;
00304                 f = e;
00305                 e = d + T1;
00306                 d = c;
00307                 c = b;
00308                 b = a;
00309                 a = T1 + T2;
00310 
00311                 j++;
00312         } while (j < 64);
00313 
00314         /* Compute the current intermediate hash value */
00315         context->state[0] += a;
00316         context->state[1] += b;
00317         context->state[2] += c;
00318         context->state[3] += d;
00319         context->state[4] += e;
00320         context->state[5] += f;
00321         context->state[6] += g;
00322         context->state[7] += h;
00323 
00324         /* Clean up */
00325         a = b = c = d = e = f = g = h = T1 = T2 = 0;
00326 }
00327 
00328 #endif /* SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM */
00329 
00336 void SHA256::SHA256_Update(SHA256_CTX* context, const sha2_byte *data, unsigned int len) {
00337         unsigned int    freespace, usedspace;
00338 
00339         if (len == 0) {
00340                 /* Calling with no data is valid - we do nothing */
00341                 return;
00342         }
00343 
00344         /* Sanity check: */
00345         assert(context != (SHA256_CTX*)0 && data != (sha2_byte*)0);
00346 
00347         usedspace = (context->bitcount >> 3) % SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00348         if (usedspace > 0) {
00349                 /* Calculate how much free space is available in the buffer */
00350                 freespace = SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace;
00351 
00352                 if (len >= freespace) {
00353                         /* Fill the buffer completely and process it */
00354                         MEMCPY_BCOPY(&context->buffer[usedspace], data, freespace);
00355                         context->bitcount += freespace << 3;
00356                         len -= freespace;
00357                         data += freespace;
00358                         SHA256_Transform(context, (sha2_word32*)context->buffer);
00359                 } else {
00360                         /* The buffer is not yet full */
00361                         MEMCPY_BCOPY(&context->buffer[usedspace], data, len);
00362                         context->bitcount += len << 3;
00363                         /* Clean up: */
00364                         usedspace = freespace = 0;
00365                         return;
00366                 }
00367         }
00368         while (len >= SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00369                 /* Process as many complete blocks as we can */
00370                 SHA256_Transform(context, (sha2_word32*)data);
00371                 context->bitcount += SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH << 3;
00372                 len -= SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00373                 data += SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00374         }
00375         if (len > 0) {
00376                 /* There's left-overs, so save 'em */
00377                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->buffer, data, len);
00378                 context->bitcount += len << 3;
00379         }
00380         /* Clean up: */
00381         usedspace = freespace = 0;
00382 }
00383 
00389 void SHA256::SHA256_Final(sha2_byte digest[], SHA256_CTX* context) {
00390         sha2_word32     *d = (sha2_word32*)digest;
00391         unsigned int    usedspace;
00392 
00393         /* Sanity check: */
00394         assert(context != (SHA256_CTX*)0);
00395 
00396         /* If no digest buffer is passed, we don't bother doing this: */
00397         if (digest != (sha2_byte*)0) {
00398                 usedspace = (context->bitcount >> 3) % SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00399 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00400                 /* Convert FROM host byte order */
00401                 REVERSE64(context->bitcount,context->bitcount);
00402 #endif
00403                 if (usedspace > 0) {
00404                         /* Begin padding with a 1 bit: */
00405                         context->buffer[usedspace++] = 0x80;
00406 
00407                         if (usedspace <= SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00408                                 /* Set-up for the last transform: */
00409                                 MEMSET_BZERO(&context->buffer[usedspace], SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace);
00410                         } else {
00411                                 if (usedspace < SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00412                                         MEMSET_BZERO(&context->buffer[usedspace], SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace);
00413                                 }
00414                                 /* Do second-to-last transform: */
00415                                 SHA256_Transform(context, (sha2_word32*)context->buffer);
00416 
00417                                 /* And set-up for the last transform: */
00418                                 MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00419                         }
00420                 } else {
00421                         /* Set-up for the last transform: */
00422                         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00423 
00424                         /* Begin padding with a 1 bit: */
00425                         *context->buffer = 0x80;
00426                 }
00427                 /* Set the bit count: */
00428                 *(sha2_word64*)&context->buffer[SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH] = context->bitcount;
00429 
00430                 /* Final transform: */
00431                 SHA256_Transform(context, (sha2_word32*)context->buffer);
00432 
00433 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00434                 {
00435                         /* Convert TO host byte order */
00436                         int     j;
00437                         for (j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
00438                                 REVERSE32(context->state[j],context->state[j]);
00439                                 *d++ = context->state[j];
00440                         }
00441                 }
00442 #else
00443                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(d, context->state, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00444 #endif
00445         }
00446 
00447         /* Clean up state data: */
00448         MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00449         usedspace = 0;
00450 }
00451 
00459 char* SHA256::SHA256_End(SHA256_CTX* context, char buffer[]) {
00460         sha2_byte       digest[SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH], *d = digest;
00461         int             i;
00462 
00463         /* Sanity check: */
00464         assert(context != (SHA256_CTX*)0);
00465 
00466         if (buffer != (char*)0) {
00467                 SHA256_Final(digest, context);
00468 
00469                 for (i = 0; i < SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH; i++) {
00470                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[(*d & 0xf0) >> 4];
00471                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[*d & 0x0f];
00472                         d++;
00473                 }
00474                 *buffer = (char)0;
00475         } else {
00476                 MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00477         }
00478         MEMSET_BZERO(digest, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00479         return buffer;
00480 }
